result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter to the defendant dated 07/22/2019 re: request address and/or phone number for poster of cash bond
Refund check of cash bond posted has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to Forward.

2:13 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Bradley Jansen.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea NO CONTEST Alford Plea to count 1 on 2017CF165 and the balance of the counts and cases will be dismissed and read-in, and PSI is requested and defense will also be requesting a second PSI.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST Alford plea.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged on count 1 in 2017CF165 and orders count 2 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders all other cases be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Presentence investigation be conducted and filed with the Court in 90 days.  Court sets for Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2019 at 11:00 a.m. (1 hour)

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.

Statement by Atty Jansen - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing on 17CF42.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court on 2017CF42.  Attorney Jansen and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Jansen enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  

2017CF165 (Preliminary Hearing)

Scott Strahan sworn, direct by DA Christenson is a 
Sargeant for Partol for the City of Berlin Police Department.  Was employed in the date in question.  Venue established.  Testimony given.  Identified the defendant present in court.  DA offers State's Exhibit #1 - Extraction Report of Text Messages from cell phone.  No objection by Atty Jansen.  Court receives State's Exhibit #1.  Cross exam by Atty Jansen.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.  DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to the Atty Jansen.  Atty Jansen and defendant confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Atty Jansen enters a plea of Not Guilty.

2016CF99 (Preliminary Hearing)

Scott Strahan sworn, direct by DA Christenson is employed for the City of Berlin Police Department as a Drug Investigator.  Was employed on the date in question.  Venue established.  Testimony given.  Identified the defendant present in court.  Cross exam by Atty Jansen.

Argument by DA Christenson.  Argument by Atty Jansen.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.  DA requests 30 days to file information.  Statement by the Court regarding Speedy Trial.  Court will schedule Arraignment after the Information has been filed.

Court adjourned at 2:53 p.m.

1:04 p.mn.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 18, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.
